prompt_text:
Create a donor-centered monthly giving appeal for [ORGANIZATION NAME] to convert recent one-time donors into sustainers.

The monthly giving appeal should:
- Be written for recent one-time donors in [CITY/COMMUNITY] who support [MISSION/CAUSE]
- Deliver: 3 subject lines, 1 preview text (60–90 chars), and a 300–400 word body
- Structure the body in this order: (1) Hook tied to [CURRENT NEED/SEASON]; (2) Why monthly matters for steady services; (3) Suggested monthly amounts [SUGGESTED AMOUNTS: e.g., 15/25/35] with a coffee comparison (e.g., “about [COFFEE COST]”); (4) Annual impact math for each amount using [IMPACT METRIC/UNIT COST EXAMPLES]; (5) Flexibility (“change or cancel anytime”); (6) Address “I already gave” graciously; (7) Benefits of joining [SUSTAINER PROGRAM NAME] ([BENEFITS LIST]); (8) 1–2 sentence donor quote: [DONOR TESTIMONIAL SNIPPET]; (9) Clear CTA line + button copy options (2–3) linking to [LINK]; (10) P.S. that reinforces ease/impact
- Use [TONE]: FORMAL (professional, concise), WARM (friendly, grateful), or CASUAL (conversational, upbeat)
- Write at a 6th–8th grade reading level; 1–2 sentence paragraphs; a few skimmable bullets
- Emphasize reliability of monthly gifts (e.g., “keeps lights on, staff scheduled, clients served”)
- Include optional fee note: invite ACH/bank transfer; offer “add $1–$2 to cover fees—totally optional”
- Be donor-centered (“you”), concrete (name [PROGRAM EXAMPLE], cite [IMPACT METRIC]), and specific about outcomes this month
- End with sign-off: [SIGNER NAME], [SIGNER TITLE], and a reply-to line for questions

Aim for specificity, warmth, and clarity. Avoid jargon, guilt, crisis-only framing, or comparisons that disparage other services. Do not overpromise. Keep the monthly ask manageable, show annual impact math, and make flexibility explicit. The copy should be usable as both an email and donation page intro with minimal edits.

scenarios.name: Small Community Org
scenarios.description: Volunteer-led rural food pantry serving a small Appalachian town; recent one-time donors are local neighbors who gave to a holiday drive.

values.CITY/COMMUNITY: Cedar Grove, WV and the Kanawha Valley
values.MISSION/CAUSE: hunger relief and neighbor-to-neighbor food assistance
values.CURRENT NEED/SEASON: winter heating season and holiday meal demand
values.IMPACT METRIC/UNIT COST EXAMPLES: About $1.50 provides the food for one pantry meal; $9 fills one Weekend Backpack Bag for a child; $25 buys a case of shelf-stable milk.
BENEFITS LIST: quarterly impact email with local stories
one consolidated tax receipt each January
optional name listing on our pantry wall
values.DONOR TESTIMONIAL SNIPPET: I can’t be there every distribution day, but $25 a month lets me show up for neighbors all year. It feels good to know kids have weekend food.

scenarios.name: Mid-Size Professional Org
scenarios.description: Urban arts education nonprofit serving teens on Chicago’s South Side; recent one-time donors came from a spring showcase.

values.MISSION/CAUSE: free after-school arts education and mentoring for teens
values.CURRENT NEED/SEASON: back-to-school enrollment and fall class prep
values.IMPACT METRIC/UNIT COST EXAMPLES: $10 covers one student studio hour; $25 equips a teen with a sketchbook + supplies; $60 funds one hour of a teaching artist’s time.
values.DONOR TESTIMONIAL SNIPPET: Knowing my monthly gift keeps the lights on and the studio open after school makes me proud to be part of the Collective.

scenarios.name: Large Established Org
scenarios.description: Regional conservation nonprofit with staff scientists and volunteers restoring Lake Erie shoreline; donors include boaters and families across Greater Cleveland.

values.CITY/COMMUNITY: Greater Cleveland and the Lake Erie shoreline
values.MISSION/CAUSE: protecting and restoring Great Lakes habitats and urban shorelines
values.CURRENT NEED/SEASON: spring planting and shoreline restoration season
values.IMPACT METRIC/UNIT COST EXAMPLES: $3 plants one native shoreline plant; $15 equips a volunteer for a workday; $40 covers a monthly water-quality test kit.
BENEFITS LIST: quarterly science briefings with our ecologists
values.DONOR TESTIMONIAL SNIPPET: As a Lake Erie kayaker, I see the difference native plants make. My monthly gift is a steady way to protect the water I love.

outputs.content:
**Subject Line Options:**

*   Warm Homes & Full Bellies: Your Monthly Gift Makes a Difference
*   Keep Cedar Grove Warm: Become a Monthly Neighbor Today
*   A Small Gift, A Big Impact: Join Our Monthly Circle!

**Preview Text:**

Turn your one-time gift into steady support. Help neighbors thrive all year long.

---

Dear [Donor Name],

Thank you so much for your recent generous gift to Cedar Grove Community Pantry. Your support truly made a difference for families facing hunger in Cedar Grove and across the Kanawha Valley.

As the weather turns colder and holiday gatherings approach, the need for food assistance often grows. Heating bills climb, and families stretch their budgets even thinner to put food on the table. Your donation helped us prepare for this busy season!

While your one-time gift was deeply appreciated, reliable support allows us to plan for the future. Monthly donations are like a steady heartbeat, ensuring our pantry doors stay open, shelves are stocked, and programs like Weekend Backpack Bags for Kids continue without interruption. They help us keep the lights on, staff scheduled, and clients served consistently, all year round.

Imagine the impact of a small, regular gift:

*   **About $15 a month** (like one coffee a week)
    *   Provides food for 10 pantry meals every single month.
    *   Annually, this covers 120 meals for our neighbors.
*   **About $25 a month** (like two coffees a week)
    *   Fills one Weekend Backpack Bag for a child monthly.
    *   Annually, this provides 12 weekend bags and over 200 pantry meals.
*   **About $35 a month** (like a few coffees a week)
    *   Buys a full case of shelf-stable milk for families each month.
    *   Annually, this provides over 400 meals and essential dairy.

Of course, life changes, and so can your giving. You can always adjust or cancel your monthly gift at any time – no questions asked.

We know you've already given, and we're so grateful! Consider this an invitation to extend that generosity and become an even more powerful force for good in our community, ensuring help is always there.

Join our **Neighbor Table Monthly Circle** and enjoy special benefits:

*   Quarterly impact emails with local stories
*   Invites to member volunteer nights
*   One consolidated tax receipt each January
*   Optional name listing on our pantry wall

As one of our monthly donors, Sarah, shared: "*I can’t be there every distribution day, but $25 a month lets me show up for neighbors all year. It feels good to know kids have weekend food.*"

Will you join Sarah and make your impact ongoing?

[**Become a Monthly Neighbor**]
[**Set Up Your Monthly Gift**]
[**Join the Neighbor Table Monthly Circle**]

Every dollar goes directly to feeding our community. For ACH/bank transfer options or to help cover processing fees (totally optional – just add $1-2 to your gift!), please contact us.

Thank you for being a vital part of Cedar Grove Community Pantry.

Warmly,

Lena Ortiz
Executive Director

P.S. Signing up is quick, easy, and provides crucial, dependable support so we can keep nourishing our neighbors month after month.

Have questions? Reply to this email or call us at [Pantry Phone Number].

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, usable monthly giving appeal that hits all major requirements with appropriate warmth and donor-centered language. The structure follows the template precisely, impact math is clear and compelling, and the tone feels genuine for a small community organization. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic phrasing in places and one mathematical inconsistency in the impact calculations.
strengths: Excellent adherence to the 10-part structure with all required elements present and in correct order
Strong, concrete impact math that makes monthly giving tangible (10 meals, 120 annually, etc.)
Warm, donor-centered tone throughout with appropriate gratitude and community language ('neighbors,' 'show up for')
Effective 'I already gave' acknowledgment that feels gracious rather than pushy
Clear, actionable CTA with multiple button copy options as requested
Good reading level and skimmability with short paragraphs and bullet formatting
Coffee comparison integrated naturally and consistently across all three giving levels
Flexibility message is explicit and reassuring ('no questions asked')
Subject lines are varied, relevant to season/need, and appropriately warm
weaknesses: Minor math inconsistency: $25/month should yield ~16-17 meals monthly at $1.50/meal, not enough to also fill a backpack bag ($9) unless rounding generously
The $35 level impact ('over 400 meals annually') doesn't show clear monthly breakdown like the other tiers
Preview text is 81 characters (good) but could be slightly more specific to the organization's unique value
Some phrases feel slightly templated ('powerful force for good,' 'vital part') rather than distinctly Cedar Grove-voiced
Missing the actual phone number placeholder in reply-to line (though this is minor and expected to be filled in)

outputs.content:
# SUBJECT LINES

**Option 1:** Can you be there for Cedar Grove neighbors every month?

**Option 2:** Winter is here—your monthly gift keeps the pantry ready

**Option 3:** You showed up once. Want to show up all year?

---

# PREVIEW TEXT

**Make your impact steady—join Neighbor Table Monthly Circle today.**

---

# EMAIL BODY

**Friend,**

You made a difference. Your recent gift helped us serve families right here in Cedar Grove and across the Kanawha Valley.

Now winter is here—and families are choosing between heating bills and holiday meals. Kids still need weekend food. Neighbors still need us every Tuesday and Thursday.

**Monthly giving means we can plan.**

When you give monthly, we can keep the lights on, staff scheduled, and clients served—no matter what the month brings. Your steady support fills Weekend Backpack Bags for Kids, stocks our shelves with basics like milk and peanut butter, and ensures no one leaves empty-handed.

**Here's what your monthly gift provides:**

- **$15/month** (about a coffee and muffin each week)  
  **= $180/year = 120 pantry meals**

- **$25/month** (less than one streaming service)  
  **= $300/year = 33 Weekend Backpack Bags for kids**

- **$35/month** (about one takeout meal)  
  **= $420/year = 16+ cases of shelf-stable milk**

*Based on: $1.50 provides one pantry meal | $9 fills one Weekend Backpack Bag | $25 buys a case of milk*

**You're always in control.** Change your amount or cancel anytime—no questions asked.

**I know you already gave.** We're so grateful. This is simply an invitation to spread that generosity across the whole year, so your impact never stops.

**When you join Neighbor Table Monthly Circle, you receive:**

- Quarterly impact emails with local stories
- Invites to member volunteer nights
- One consolidated tax receipt each January
- Optional name listing on our pantry wall

*"I can't be there every distribution day, but $25 a month lets me show up for neighbors all year. It feels good to know kids have weekend food."*  
— Mark T., monthly donor since 2022

**Will you become a monthly neighbor today?**

👉 [**Yes, I'll give monthly**] [**Join for $25/month**] [**Start my monthly gift**]

Visit **https://cedargrovepantry.org/monthly** to get started.

*Prefer bank transfer/ACH to save on fees? We offer that option! You can also add $1–$2 to cover processing costs—totally optional but deeply appreciated.*

Questions? Just reply to this email—I read every one.

With gratitude,

**Lena Ortiz**  
Executive Director  
Cedar Grove Community Pantry

---

**P.S.** Setting up a monthly gift takes two minutes and makes an impact all year long. $25 a month = 33 kids with weekend food. That's the power of showing up every month.

*Questions about monthly giving? Reply anytime or email lena@cedargrovepantry.org.*

evaluation.reasoning: This is a highly polished, professional monthly giving appeal that fulfills nearly all prompt requirements with appropriate warmth and donor-centered language. The structure is clear, the impact math is compelling, and it balances emotional appeal with practical details. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic phrasing in places and the preview text exceeding the character limit.
strengths: Excellent structure following all 10 required elements in order with clear transitions
Strong impact math that is concrete and easy to understand ($15=$180/year=120 meals)
Warm, donor-centered tone throughout with appropriate use of 'you' and gratitude
Gracious handling of 'I already gave' objection without guilt or pressure
Multiple CTA button options and clear flexibility messaging
Reading level appropriate (6th-8th grade) with short paragraphs and skimmable bullets
Effective use of local details (Cedar Grove, Kanawha Valley, Tuesday/Thursday distributions)
Strong P.S. that reinforces ease and impact as requested
Authentic donor testimonial integration that feels natural
Professional sign-off with reply invitation
weaknesses: Preview text is 66 characters including spaces, which is within range but could be optimized to use the full 60-90 character allowance for better email client display
Some comparison language is slightly generic ('less than one streaming service') though not inappropriate
The email body is approximately 420 words, slightly exceeding the 300-400 word target, though this is minor
Could have been more specific about which 'local stories' appear in quarterly emails to enhance concreteness

outputs.content:
Subject lines
- Warm meals through winter: make your gift monthly for Cedar Grove neighbors
- Join the Neighbor Table Monthly Circle and keep Kanawha Valley fed
- From one-time to every time: your steady help powers holiday meals

Preview text
Keep lights on, shelves stocked, and Weekend Backpack Bags ready all winter.

Body
When the heat kicks on, grocery budgets shrink. This month and through the holidays, more Cedar Grove and Kanawha Valley families will come for pantry groceries, holiday fixings, and Weekend Backpack Bags for Kids.

Your monthly gift keeps help steady. It lets us plan routes, stock staples, and be ready—no matter the weather. Monthly support keeps the lights on, staff scheduled, trucks fueled, and neighbors served.

Would you make your one-time gift a monthly habit?
- $15/month (about $3.50 a week)
- $25/month (about $6 a week)
- $35/month (about $8 a week)

Here’s what a year of your monthly gift can do:
- $15/month = $180/year
  - About 120 pantry meals
  - 20 Weekend Backpack Bags for Kids
  - About 7 cases of shelf-stable milk
- $25/month = $300/year
  - About 200 pantry meals
  - About 33 Weekend Backpack Bags
  - 12 cases of shelf-stable milk
- $35/month = $420/year
  - About 280 pantry meals
  - About 46 Weekend Backpack Bags
  - About 17 cases of shelf-stable milk

You’re in control—change or cancel anytime. Prefer ACH/bank transfer? It reduces fees. Or add $1–$2 to cover fees—totally optional.

Already gave this fall? Thank you. Your gift helped stock our shelves for busy holiday distributions. A monthly gift is a simple next step that carries that care into every month.

Join the Neighbor Table Monthly Circle and enjoy:
- Quarterly impact email with local stories
- Invites to member volunteer nights
- One consolidated tax receipt each January
- Optional name listing on our pantry wall

“I can’t be there every distribution day, but $25 a month lets me show up for neighbors all year. It feels good to know kids have weekend food.”

Ready to keep neighbors fed all winter and beyond? Join here: https://cedargrovepantry.org/monthly
Button options:
- Start your monthly gift
- Join the Neighbor Table
- Give $25/month

P.S. It takes about two minutes to set up, and you can update it anytime. Your steady gift this month helps fill holiday meal boxes and Weekend Backpack Bags for kids right here in Cedar Grove.

With gratitude,
Lena Ortiz
Executive Director
Questions? Just reply to this email.

evaluation.reasoning: This is a highly usable, well-structured monthly giving appeal that hits all required elements with appropriate warmth and specificity. The copy balances donor-centeredness with concrete impact, uses accessible language, and addresses common objections gracefully. Minor weaknesses include slightly mechanical impact math formatting and a coffee comparison that doesn't quite align with the monthly amounts as specified.
strengths: Excellent structural adherence—all 10 required elements present in correct order, from seasonal hook through P.S.
Strong donor-centered language throughout ('you're in control,' 'your steady gift') with concrete local details (Cedar Grove, Kanawha Valley, Weekend Backpack Bags)
Impact math is clear, specific, and compelling, showing three different metrics per giving level to appeal to different donor motivations
Gracious handling of 'I already gave' objection that validates past giving while framing monthly as a natural next step
Warm, conversational tone appropriate for small community org without being overly casual or unprofessional
Effective use of short paragraphs and bullets for skimmability; reading level appears appropriate for 6th-8th grade
Strong P.S. that reinforces both ease and immediate seasonal impact
Benefits list well-integrated and appropriate for volunteer-led organization scale
weaknesses: Coffee comparison math is slightly off—prompt asks to compare monthly amounts to coffee cost ($3.50), but copy divides monthly by ~4 weeks rather than showing '$15/month is about the cost of 4 coffees.' The weekly breakdown is useful but doesn't fulfill the specific 'coffee comparison' instruction as clearly as it could
Impact math formatting, while accurate, reads somewhat mechanically with repetitive 'About' qualifiers—minor polish could improve flow
Donor quote integration is good but could be set off visually (em-dash, italics notation) to make it more scannable as testimonial rather than body copy

outputs.content:
**Tone:** Warm and Conversational

---

**Subject Lines:**

* Your Back-to-School Gift Can Do More!
* Imagine Every Teen Having a Creative Space – Monthly Makes It Happen!
* A Small Monthly Gift, a Big Impact for South Side Teens!

**Preview Text:** Keep the creativity flowing after school for South Side teens. Become a monthly art sustainer today!

---

Dear [Donor Name],

Remember that amazing feeling you got when you supported South Side Arts Collective recently? As school bells ring again, we're buzzing with excitement – and a little bit of healthy pressure! Our Open Studio Afternoons are filling up fast for the fall, and we're getting ready to welcome even more talented teens.

Your recent one-time gift was a huge help. It gave a young artist the chance to pick up a paintbrush or sculpt with clay. Now, imagine if that support could be there, every single month, like a steady beacon for creativity.

That's why we're inviting you to join our **Canvas Crew Monthly**. By giving a little regularly, you create a reliable foundation for all our free after-school arts education and mentoring. It ensures we can keep the lights on, our amazing teaching artists scheduled, and vital art supplies stocked for every student who walks through our doors.

Think about it:

*   **For about the cost of a fancy coffee ($5.25 a week)**, your $25 monthly gift creates a world of difference.
*   **A monthly gift of $15** means a steady $180 over the year. That's enough to cover 18 student studio hours, giving many teens a chance to explore art.
*   **Your $25 monthly contribution** adds up to $300 annually. That equips 12 teens with a sketchbook and essential supplies, sparking their artistic journey.
*   **With $50 a month**, you provide $600 each year. This funds 10 hours of a teaching artist’s time, helping countless students learn and grow.

Life changes, and so can your giving. You can change or cancel your monthly gift at any time – no questions asked!

We know you generously gave recently, and we're so grateful for that. This is just an invitation to make an even bigger, more consistent impact. It’s about creating a dependable flow of support so we can plan ahead and offer the best programs possible.

As a member of our **Canvas Crew Monthly**, you'll also get some cool perks:

*   Early invites to student showcases
*   Behind-the-scenes studio updates
*   A special member sticker and digital badge
*   One annual consolidated receipt for easy tax prep

Knowing my monthly gift keeps the lights on and the studio open after school makes me proud to be part of the Collective. – Juanita R., Canvas Crew Monthly Donor

Ready to make a lasting difference? Click the link below to become a Canvas Crew Monthly member today!

[Join the Canvas Crew Monthly!](https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly)
[Become a Monthly Sustainer](https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly)
[Sign Up for Monthly Giving](https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly)

P.S. Setting up your monthly gift is quick and easy, and it truly makes all the difference in providing consistent, joyful art experiences for South Side teens. We also welcome gifts via ACH/bank transfer if you prefer, and you can even choose to add $1-$2 to your gift to help cover processing fees – totally optional!

Warmly,

Marcus Lee
Development Manager
South Side Arts Collective

Questions? Just hit reply to this email, or reach out to marcus.lee@southsidearts.org.

evaluation.reasoning: The output fulfills nearly all prompt requirements with good structure and donor-centered language. However, there's a tone mismatch (labeled 'Warm and Conversational' when 'CASUAL' was requested), some calculations are slightly off, and certain phrases feel generic rather than authentically voice-driven for this specific organization.
strengths: Excellent structural completeness - includes all 10 required elements in correct order (hook, monthly rationale, amounts with coffee comparison, impact math, flexibility, 'already gave' acknowledgment, benefits, testimonial, CTA, P.S.)
Strong donor-centered language with effective use of 'you' and concrete specifics (Open Studio Afternoons, student studio hours, teaching artists)
Clear, skimmable formatting with short paragraphs, bullets, and multiple CTA button options
Good impact math presentation showing annual totals for each giving level
Appropriate reading level and avoidance of jargon or guilt-based framing
Includes optional fee coverage and ACH mention as requested
weaknesses: Tone label inconsistency - output says 'Warm and Conversational' but prompt requested 'CASUAL' (though the actual copy does lean casual/conversational)
Math error in coffee comparison - '$5.25 a week' would be ~$21/month, not $25; the comparison is imprecise

Impact math calculation issues: $15/month = $180/year divided by $10/hour = 18 hours (correct), but $25/month = $300/year divided by $25/supplies = 12 students (correct), and $50/month = $600/year divided by $60/hour = 10 hours (correct) - actually the math is accurate on review
Some phrases feel templated rather than organization-specific ('steady beacon for creativity,' 'world of difference') - could be more distinctive to South Side Arts Collective's voice
Preview text is 95 characters, slightly exceeding the 60-90 character guideline
Minor: The testimonial attribution format differs slightly from how it might appear in real donor communications (full name vs. first name + last initial)

outputs.content:
# SUBJECT LINES

**1.** Fall classes start Monday—can we count on you monthly?

**2.** You gave once. Ready to become a Canvas Crew sustainer?

**3.** From one-time supporter to monthly champion (just $15/mo!)

---

# PREVIEW TEXT

**Keep our studios open every afternoon—join Canvas Crew Monthly today.**

---

# EMAIL BODY

**Hey [First Name],**

**Our fall session kicks off this Monday.**

Right now, teaching artists are prepping canvases, stocking clay bins, and setting up Open Studio Afternoons for 140 South Side teens. Your gift this summer helped make it possible—and we're so grateful.

**Here's the thing: one-time gifts fuel big moments. Monthly gifts keep the lights on.**

When you become a Canvas Crew Monthly donor, you give us something priceless: predictability. We can schedule teaching artists, keep studios open after school five days a week, and say *yes* when a student needs supplies—because we know you'll be there.

**What does monthly look like?**

• **$15/month** (about a fancy latte) = **$180/year** = 18 student studio hours  
• **$25/month** (less than lunch out) = **$300/year** = 12 teens equipped with sketchbooks and supplies  
• **$50/month** (one tank of gas) = **$600/year** = 10 hours of teaching artist time

**You can change or cancel anytime.** No questions asked.

**"But I already gave!"**

You did—and it mattered. This is just an invitation to stretch that generosity across the whole school year, so every Tuesday afternoon and every new student knows we're here for the long haul.

**When you join Canvas Crew Monthly, you get:**

• Early invites to student showcases  
• Behind-the-scenes studio updates  
• Member sticker and digital badge  
• Annual consolidated receipt (one tax document, zero hassle)

*"Knowing my monthly gift keeps the lights on and the studio open after school makes me proud to be part of the Collective."* —Aisha T., Canvas Crew Monthly donor

**[JOIN CANVAS CREW MONTHLY →](https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly)**

*Button copy options:*  
• **Yes, count me in monthly**  
• **Become a sustainer**  
• **Start my Canvas Crew gift**

*(Prefer ACH/bank transfer? Choose that option to skip card fees. Want to add $1–$2 to cover processing? Totally optional, totally appreciated.)*

**Thank you for believing in our students.**

Marcus Lee  
Development Manager  
South Side Arts Collective

*Questions? Just reply—I read every email.*

---

**P.S.** It takes two minutes to set up, and you'll know 140 teens have a creative home waiting for them every single school day this year. That's the power of monthly. **[Start here →](https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly)**

evaluation.reasoning: This is an exceptionally strong monthly giving appeal that hits nearly every requirement with skill. The casual tone is pitch-perfect, the structure follows the template precisely, and the copy is donor-centered, concrete, and actionable. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic coffee comparisons and a donor quote that could be more distinctive, but these don't significantly detract from overall quality.
strengths: Excellent casual tone execution—conversational without being unprofessional ('Here's the thing,' 'zero hassle,' 'just reply')
Strong donor-centered framing throughout, especially the gracious 'I already gave' acknowledgment that validates past support
Crystal-clear impact math with specific, believable metrics tied to actual programs (18 studio hours, 12 teens with supplies)
Effective use of white space and skimmable bullets that work for both email and donation page formats
Smart urgency hook (fall session starts Monday) without crisis framing or guilt
All 10 structural elements present and in correct order, including flexibility language, benefits list, testimonial, and fee note
Concrete program example (Open Studio Afternoons) and specific number (140 teens) add credibility
P.S. reinforces ease AND impact as requested, with clear time estimate ('two minutes')
Multiple CTA button options provided as specified
Reading level appropriate—short sentences, accessible vocabulary, no jargon
weaknesses: Coffee/latte comparison at $15/month is slightly off from the $5.25 specified cost (though 'fancy latte' provides wiggle room)
Donor testimonial, while functional, is somewhat generic—could be from any sustainer program
Preview text is 72 characters (within range) but could be punchier or more benefit-focused

outputs.content:
Subject lines
- South Side teens are enrolling now—will you go monthly?
- Keep our studio open after school this fall—join Canvas Crew Monthly
- Before classes start: turn your gift into steady support

Preview text (60–90 chars)
Your steady gift powers Open Studio Afternoons—flexible, change anytime.

Body (300–400 words, WARM tone)
Back-to-school is here on the South Side. We’re enrolling new teens and setting up fall classes—stocking sketchbooks, prepping canvases, and getting Open Studio Afternoons ready right after school.

This is when monthly gifts matter most. Your steady support keeps the studio lights on, staff scheduled, and students welcomed—every day, not just the day you give.

Would you consider becoming a Canvas Crew Monthly member at one of these easy levels?
- $15/month — about $3.75 a week (less than a coffee)
- $25/month — about $6.25 a week (around a $5.25 latte)
- $50/month — about $12.50 a week (two coffees)

Here’s the real, annual impact your monthly gift makes:
- $15/month = $180/year = 18 student studio hours (at $10/hour)
- $25/month = $300/year = 12 sketchbook + supply kits (at $25 each)
- $50/month = $600/year = 10 hours of a teaching artist’s time (at $60/hour)

You’re always in control—change or cancel anytime in two clicks.

And if you’re thinking, “I already gave,” thank you. Your recent one-time gift helped us get through summer. Going monthly now makes sure teens can count on us all year, including this month’s after-school rush.

When you join Canvas Crew Monthly, you’ll receive:
- Early invites to student showcases
- Behind-the-scenes studio updates
- Member sticker and digital badge
- One annual consolidated receipt

“Knowing my monthly gift keeps the lights on and the studio open after school makes me proud to be part of the Collective.”

Prefer to reduce fees? Choose ACH/bank transfer at checkout, or add $1–$2 to cover fees—totally optional.

Ready to turn your impact into something teens can count on every week?
- Start my monthly gift → https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly
- Join Canvas Crew Monthly → https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly
- Make it monthly → https://southsidearts.org/give-monthly

P.S. It takes just a minute to set up, and your monthly gift starts helping teens in Open Studio Afternoons right away.

With gratitude,
Marcus Lee, Development Manager
Questions? Reply to this email or contact giving@southsidearts.org (we read every note).

However, it misses the requested CASUAL tone (delivering WARM instead), contains mathematical errors in the coffee comparison, and feels somewhat formulaic despite good donor-centered language.
strengths: Excellent completeness—includes all 10 structural elements in correct order with proper formatting
Strong donor-centered language throughout ('you,' 'your impact,' 'you're in control')
Clear, concrete impact metrics with specific annual math that makes monthly giving tangible
Gracious handling of 'I already gave' objection without guilt
Good readability with short paragraphs, bullets, and skimmable format at appropriate grade level
Professional sign-off with reply-to invitation creates accessibility
Effective P.S. that reinforces ease and immediate impact
weaknesses: Tone mismatch—requested CASUAL but delivered WARM/professional (lacks conversational, upbeat energy expected for arts org)
Coffee math errors: $15/month is $3.75/week but comparison says 'less than a coffee'; $25/month is $6.25/week but compared to '$5.25 latte' (doesn't work mathematically)
Subject lines are functional but lack the creative spark expected from an arts organization
Preview text at 73 characters is good but could be punchier for CASUAL tone
Feels template-driven rather than authentically voice-specific to a South Side arts collective
Minor: 'two clicks' claim about canceling is specific enough to be verifiable/risky if untrue

**Tone:** Formal and Warm

---

**Subject Lines:**

*   Spring into Action: Protect Lake Erie's Shoreline, Every Month
*   Your Impact, Amplified: Become a Lake Guardian Today
*   From One-Time to Ongoing: Sustaining Lake Erie's Future

**Preview Text:** Your gift helped us last month. Imagine the steady impact of protecting Lake Erie year-round.

---

Dear [Donor Name],

As the days lengthen and the air warms, our teams are already busy planning for this spring’s planting and restoration season. We're eager to get native plants into the ground along our urban shorelines and ensure Lake Erie thrives for all of us.

Your recent gift to Great Lakes Conservation Alliance made a real difference. Thank you for your commitment to our local waters. Now, we invite you to take that impact further by becoming a monthly Lake Guardian.

Monthly gifts are the backbone of our work. They provide steady support, ensuring we can keep our lights on, staff scheduled, and vital projects like our Urban Shorelines Project moving forward. This reliable funding lets us plan for the long term and respond quickly when opportunities arise.

Just a small, regular amount can create a significant, lasting impact:

*   **$20 a month** (about the cost of a few premium coffees, or $4.75 a week) provides annual funding to:
    *   Plant 80 native shoreline plants in critical habitats.
    *   Equip 16 volunteers for a full day of restoration.
    *   Cover two months of essential water quality testing kits.
*   **$35 a month** (about $8.25 a week) helps us:
    *   Install 140 native shoreline plants.
    *   Outfit 28 volunteers for multiple workdays.
    *   Secure over four months of water quality testing.
*   **$60 a month** (just over $14 a week) empowers us to:
    *   Plant 240 native shoreline plants, revitalizing large stretches of coastline.
    *   Support 48 volunteers throughout the season.
    *   Fund seven months of crucial water quality monitoring.

Your monthly giving is always flexible. You can change or cancel your contribution at any time, tailoring it to best suit your needs.

We understand you've already given recently, and we are deeply grateful. This invitation is simply a chance to make your dedication to Lake Erie even more powerful and consistent.

As a Lake Guardian, you’ll enjoy special benefits, connecting you closer to the impact of your generosity:

*   Quarterly science briefings with our ecologists
*   Invitations to members-only restoration days
*   Access to an interactive impact map showing progress on projects
*   An annual consolidated tax receipt for easy record-keeping

> "As a Lake Erie kayaker, I see the difference native plants make. My monthly gift is a steady way to protect the water I love." – [Donor Name, if you have permission to use a specific one, otherwise remove this and keep the quote general.]

Join a dedicated community of supporters committed to a healthier Lake Erie all year long.

**Become a Lake Guardian Today**

[Button: Join Our Monthly Guardians]
[Button: Give Monthly Now]

*Optional: Please consider adding $1–$2 to your monthly gift to help cover processing fees, allowing 100% of your chosen amount to go directly to our programs. This is completely optional.*

P.S. Setting up a monthly gift is easy and makes a world of difference for Lake Erie. Your continuous support means our restoration efforts never miss a beat.

With sincere gratitude,

Dr. Aisha Patel
Director of Development
Great Lakes Conservation Alliance

Reply to: questions@greatlakesalliance.org

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional monthly giving appeal that hits most requirements and would be immediately usable by a nonprofit. The tone is appropriately formal yet warm, the impact math is clear and compelling, and the structure flows logically. However, it misses a few specific prompt requirements and contains minor calculation errors that would need correction before deployment.
strengths: Excellent impact math presentation with clear annual calculations for each giving level ($20/month = 80 plants at $3 each, etc.)
Strong adherence to formal tone while maintaining warmth and donor-centeredness throughout
Well-structured with skimmable bullets, short paragraphs, and clear progression through all major elements
Effective use of concrete program example (Urban Shorelines Project) and specific impact metrics
Professional handling of 'I already gave' objection without guilt or pressure
Clear CTA with multiple button options and proper placement of optional fee language
weaknesses: Missing the required 60-90 character preview text specification (provided text is 92 characters)
Coffee comparison math is slightly off - describes weekly cost rather than the simpler '$4.75 coffee' comparison requested in prompt
Does not explicitly mention ACH/bank transfer option as requested in the fee note section
The 300-400 word target is exceeded (body is approximately 450 words)
Donor testimonial includes bracketed instruction '[Donor Name, if you have permission...]' that should be removed or simplified for cleaner delivery

outputs.content:
# MONTHLY GIVING APPEAL: GREAT LAKES CONSERVATION ALLIANCE

---

## SUBJECT LINES

**Subject 1:** Spring is planting season—join Lake Guardians Monthly today  
**Subject 2:** Your monthly gift = 12 months of healthier shorelines  
**Subject 3:** [Name], become a Lake Guardian this spring (it's flexible!)

---

## PREVIEW TEXT

**Preview:** Monthly support means steady restoration. Join today—change or pause anytime.

---

## EMAIL BODY

**[Salutation]**

Right now, our crews are planting native sedges and wildflowers along Cleveland's Urban Shorelines.

Every seedling strengthens the lake you love. And every monthly gift makes that work possible—not just this spring, but all year long.

**Why monthly giving matters**

Your one-time gift last year made an immediate difference. Thank you.

Monthly support does something more: it lets us plan. We can schedule restoration days, order native plants in bulk, and keep our water-quality monitoring on schedule. Steady income means steady progress.

**Join Lake Guardians Monthly**

We're inviting recent supporters like you to become monthly donors this spring.

**Choose the level that fits:**

- **$20/month** — less than a fancy latte ($4.75/week)  
- **$35/month** — about one coffee date  
- **$60/month** — roughly two pizzas  

**Your annual impact**

- **$20/month** = **$240/year** → 80 native shoreline plants installed  
- **$35/month** = **$420/year** → 28 volunteers fully equipped for restoration workdays  
- **$60/month** = **$720/year** → 18 monthly water-quality test kits covering a full monitoring site  

Every dollar plants roots. Literally.

**Total flexibility**

Change your amount, pause, or cancel anytime online or with one email. No hassle.

**"I already gave this year"**

We're grateful! This invitation is optional—just for those who want the ease of automatic support and the deeper connection monthly giving brings.

**Lake Guardians Monthly benefits**

- Quarterly science briefings with our ecologists  
- Invitation to members-only restoration days  
- Interactive impact map access  
- Annual consolidated tax receipt  

**Hear from a fellow Lake Guardian:**

*"As a Lake Erie kayaker, I see the difference native plants make. My monthly gift is a steady way to protect the water I love."*  
— Karen M., Lakewood

**Join today**

Set up your monthly gift in 60 seconds:

**[START MY MONTHLY GIFT]**  
**[BECOME A LAKE GUARDIAN]**  
**[YES, I'LL GIVE MONTHLY]**

👉 **[https://greatlakesalliance.org/sustain](https://greatlakesalliance.org/sustain)**

**Prefer bank transfer?** ACH saves on fees—just reply and we'll send simple instructions. And if you'd like to add $1–$2 to cover processing costs, that's wonderful but totally optional.

Thank you for caring about our Great Lakes.

Gratefully,

**Dr. Aisha Patel**  
Director of Development  
Great Lakes Conservation Alliance

📧 Questions? Just reply—I read every message.

---

**P.S.** Monthly giving is the easiest way to make a big impact. Set it once, and you'll restore shorelines all year—while you sleep, work, and paddle. Start today: **[greatlakesalliance.org/sustain](https://greatlakesalliance.org/sustain)**

evaluation.reasoning: This is a highly professional, well-structured monthly giving appeal that fulfills nearly all prompt requirements with appropriate formal tone and donor-centered language. The copy is concrete, specific, and immediately usable with minimal edits. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic transitions and one coffee comparison inconsistency, but overall execution is strong.
strengths: Excellent structural adherence—all 10 required elements present in correct order, from seasonal hook through P.S.
Strong impact math that is clear and concrete (80 plants, 28 volunteers equipped, 18 test kits) with proper annual calculations
Effective donor-centered language throughout ('you,' 'your impact') without guilt or crisis framing
Gracious handling of 'I already gave' objection that validates past support while framing monthly as optional upgrade
Appropriate formal tone that remains warm and accessible—professional without being stiff
Reading level is spot-on (6th-8th grade), with short paragraphs, bullets, and skimmable structure
All three subject lines are distinct, actionable, and test different angles (seasonal urgency, impact math, flexibility)
ACH/fee coverage invitation is naturally integrated and truly optional as requested
Specific program naming (Urban Shorelines Project) and concrete details (sedges, wildflowers, Cleveland) avoid vagueness
CTA buttons offer genuine variety and the P.S. effectively reinforces ease + impact
weaknesses: Coffee comparison math is slightly inconsistent—'$4.75/week' for $20/month doesn't align precisely (should be ~$4.60), and '$35/month = one coffee date' is vague compared to the specific $4.75 reference
Preview text is 88 characters, which is within range but could be tightened for mobile optimization
Some phrases feel slightly templated ('Every dollar plants roots. Literally.' and 'while you sleep, work, and paddle') though they work functionally
The donor quote attribution could include the monthly amount or tenure for added credibility ('Lake Guardian for 2 years')

outputs.content:
Subject lines
- Spring planting is here—become a Lake Guardian in Greater Cleveland
- Your gift helped our shorelines—monthly giving keeps it growing
- From one-time to ongoing: help Lake Erie every month

Preview text
Spring planting is here. Your steady monthly gift powers the Urban Shorelines Project.

Body
Spring along Lake Erie means planting, rooting, and restoring. Thanks to your recent gift, the Urban Shorelines Project is on track this month to install 2,500 native shoreline plants and run water-quality tests from the Cuyahoga River mouth to Euclid Creek.

Monthly giving is how this work stays steady. Your reliable support keeps lights on, crews scheduled, volunteers equipped, and water testing continuous—week in, week out—so we can plan restoration days and deliver what our shoreline needs.

Choose a monthly amount that fits:
- $20/month — about $4.75 a week (roughly one coffee)
- $35/month — about one nice coffee every 3–4 days
- $60/month — about two coffees a week

What your gift can do over a year:
- $20/month ($240): plant up to 80 native shoreline plants; or equip 16 volunteers for workdays; or supply 6 monthly water-quality test kits.
- $35/month ($420): plant up to 140 plants; or equip 28 volunteers; or provide roughly 10 monthly test kits.
- $60/month ($720): plant up to 240 plants; or equip 48 volunteers; or fund 18 monthly test kits.

You’re in control. You can change or cancel anytime. Prefer ACH/bank transfer? Great—it reduces fees. You can also add $1–$2 to cover fees—totally optional.

Already gave? Thank you. Your one-time gift made an immediate difference. A modest monthly gift now sustains the work so we can schedule staff, train volunteers, and restore more shoreline all season.

Join Lake Guardians Monthly and enjoy:
- Quarterly science briefings with our ecologists
- Invitation to members-only restoration days
- Interactive impact map access
- Annual consolidated tax receipt

“As a Lake Erie kayaker, I see the difference native plants make. My monthly gift is a steady way to protect the water I love.”

Make your impact steady for Greater Cleveland’s urban shoreline.

CTA:
- Start my monthly gift (https://greatlakesalliance.org/sustain)
- Become a Lake Guardian (https://greatlakesalliance.org/sustain)
- Give monthly to restore Lake Erie (https://greatlakesalliance.org/sustain)

P.S. It takes two minutes, is easy to adjust anytime, and your steady support helps us plant, test, and restore every month.

With gratitude,

Dr. Aisha Patel
Director of Development
Great Lakes Conservation Alliance
Reply with questions or reach us at give@greatlakesalliance.org

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional monthly giving appeal that follows the template precisely and delivers donor-centered, concrete messaging. The formal tone is appropriate, structure is complete, and the copy is immediately usable. However, the coffee comparison math contains errors that would need correction before deployment.
strengths: Excellent adherence to template structure—all 10 required elements present in correct order
Strong donor-centered language with concrete impact metrics and specific program naming (Urban Shorelines Project)
Appropriate formal tone that remains warm and accessible, with short paragraphs and skimmable format
Effective handling of 'I already gave' objection with grace and reframing
Clear annual impact math that makes monthly gifts tangible (80 plants, 16 volunteers, etc.)
Professional subject lines that balance gratitude, seasonality, and the monthly ask
Good use of reliability language ('keeps lights on, crews scheduled, volunteers equipped')
Benefits list is specific and compelling for the audience (science briefings, restoration days)
weaknesses: Coffee comparison math is incorrect: $20/month is not '$4.75 a week' (that would be ~$20.50/month), and the other comparisons are similarly imprecise or confusing
The phrase 'about one nice coffee every 3–4 days' for $35/month is awkward and harder to visualize than a simple weekly comparison
Minor: 'Reply with questions or reach us at...' could be tightened to just the email address for cleaner formatting
The impact math uses 'up to' and 'roughly' inconsistently—could be more precise or consistently approximate
